Articles.Content:
Greetings gentlemen. This is the Official 2012 Olympics thread, where we post stuff about the Olympics going on, understand?

So, wonder how the Opening Ceremony will be...

The Olympics caused my school\'s Build-for-the-future project to close, along with many others in my town. :C

Honestly, I\'m more interested in seeing how the London Transport System will cope die under stress.

cows and pigs in the stadium!

relly?
i though the queen was RELLY going to paracute down

im finding this awesome. and the queen, jumping out of a helicopter xD id hate to be down south right now, london will be completely grid locked for the next month lol

Edit: to quote lee evans (best english comedian xD): they just make it up 'madeupistan' (said: made-up-i-stan) then the guy just runs back, changes hats, and name 'hesbackistan' (he\'s-back-i-stan)
FLUFFY BUNNIES Mr. Bean... LOL!
Watching right now. The opening has been, erm, odd to say the least.

Watching right now. The opening has been, erm, odd to say the least.

Perfect for the U.K. much better than 2008\'s.

MR BEAN FLUFFY BUNNIES YEAH!

It\'s funny: Adele couldn\'t perform because she\'s preggers.... when there\'s an 8-MONTHS PREGNANT OLYMPIAN OUT THERE!

[gmod]While I can appreciate ones enthusiasm for these games, let's not turn into a bunch of hooligans. Keep the language clean folks.[/gmod]

Cheers!

Capt\'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager

MR BEAN FLUFFY BUNNIES YEAH!

It\'s funny: Adele couldn\'t perform because she\'s preggers.... when there\'s an 8-MONTHS PREGNANT OLYMPIAN OUT THERE!

How shockingly funny! It couldn\'t possibly be that some people have different ways of dealing with pregnancy! It couldn\'t possibly be that a pregnant Olympian would be more committed to showing up at the games than someone who has no real ties or obligation to them.

Derp.
Those ceremonies were terrible in my opinion. The industrial revolution part was probably the only part I found better than mediocre, but after that everything went downhill. Fast.

Those ceremonies were terrible in my opinion. The industrial revolution part was probably the only part I found better than mediocre, but after that everything went downhill. Fast.

This.

Saw the Red Arrows go over on their way back from London yesterday.

That was probably one of the best Ceremonies I\'ve ever seen. Going to remember the Olympic Rings, Parachuting Queeny and Chariots of Fire parts for ever.

Watching right now. The opening has been, erm, odd to say the least.

are you british? im guessing not. the ceremonies are to to do with the host countrys past, present and future. it was brilliant for great britan!
I remember a month or two ago a few spitfires and hurricanes flew really low over my Dad\'s house while I was there, en route to London. That was great.
is it true that the us media CUT OUT the tribute to the 7/7 bombings?!

Yup.

And they gave an interview of Michael Phelps instead. That\'s NBC for you.

is it true that the us media CUT OUT the tribute to the 7/7 bombings?!

The US is also the reason why it was so late at night, it\'s so it would be midday in the US at the time of the opening ceremony (more people would be watching), and the US could make money from advertising.

Tragic, isn\'t it?

The US is also the reason why it was so late at night, it\'s so it would be midday in the US at the time of the opening ceremony (more people would be watching), and the US could make money from advertising.

Tragic, isn\'t it?

seriously?? is that what you think? due to the fact mods would get angry at my post, i have re-writen that first sentence 4 times to be appropriate. it was on at night in the UK by request of Danny Boyle (he was the guy who brought it all together, the head-honcho of the ceremony) as it would make a better impact at night. the us had no input to the ceremony, or to the timing. NOW STFU!!

seriously?? is that what you think? due to the fact mods would get angry at my post, i have re-writen that first sentence 4 times to be appropriate. it was on at night in the UK by request of Danny Boyle (he was the guy who brought it all together, the head-honcho of the ceremony) as it would make a better impact at night.

Yeah, no way that could possibly mean US commercial interests were involved. It\'s not like this is a billions-of-dollars\'-worth international event, right?

Whatever it was, those opening ceremonies were rather underwhelming to say the least. I want to actually watch athletes, not some self-celebratory tour de force.

Yeah, no way that could possibly mean US commercial interests were involved. It\'s not like this is a billions-of-dollars\'-worth international event, right?

Whatever it was, those opening ceremonies were rather underwhelming to say the least. I want to actually watch athletes, not some self-celebratory tour de force.

im guessing your not english? refer to the last post on the first page.
The one thing I wonder from the Opening Ceremony is, where was the WWII tribute?

im guessing your not english? refer to the last post on the first page.

I\'m guessing you think one post containing a grand total of one line of text without any rationed argument constitutes unfalsifiable proof because you are English (if I\'m guessing right)? Would you believe me if I told you America is better than the UK, because I\'m an American?

The one thing I wonder from the Opening Ceremony is, where was the WWII tribute?

The silence we had part way through the history of Britain bit.

All in all I quite enjoyed the ceremony, and I hope we put on a good show that everyone enjoyed.

Let the sports begin.
